29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

554722.name: Daythunder Anamnesis
554722.lore:
When the child of humanity drank of the crystal core, they lost the gift to sense human hearts. From then onward, their only purpose was to watch over the earth, bound to endless cycles of stars and moons.
They continued to cherish life, yet could no longer perceive neighbors as living beings.

"Prostrate upon the earth, longing for the touch of blue skies. Yet, once soaring high, the humble fragrance of grass is beyond all price..."
comeFrom: Echo of War: "Fortress of Dome" Eye of Twilight

589818.name: Starfire Essence
589818.desc: A mature heliobus that ran away after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces moderately for Nihility characters.
589818.lore:
A mean and nasty heliobus that appears like a full flame.
The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. This torch-like heliobus has just tasted consciousness and is eager to devour its host's emotions and desires.

"Absorb their emotions and sway their wills..."

673759.name: Heaven Incinerator
673759.desc: A beast-form heliobus that homogenized after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces significantly for Nihility characters.
673759.lore:
An intelligent and powerful heliobus that has started to take the form of a beast.
The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. A large heliobus, having homogenized its numerous lesser peers, will gradually have a stable shape. These immortal beings can become so dangerous that they are considered calamities.

"Floods, fires, landslides, and thunderstorms..."

874345.name: Fiery Spirit
874345.desc: Feeble heliobus that scattered after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces slightly for Nihility characters.
874345.lore:
An innocent, formless heliobus.
The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. This little heliobus is innocent and naive and may be easily consumed by more powerful heliobi.

"Formless, rootless, and roaming boundless..."

3276614.name: Echoing Wail
3276614.desc: A fractured carapace from black tide creatures. Normal material used for enhancement.
3276614.lore:
Grotesque heads roar, ragged blades keen enough to sunder all, while the genesis of the scourge still lurks, veiled in the shadows and shrouded by the mists of death.

"Why do you lament alone at the gravestone?"
comeFrom: Black Tide Creatures at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

3517880.name: Ethereal Omen
3517880.desc: A fragment dropped by black tide creatures. Crude material used for enhancement.
3517880.lore:
Misfortune often creeps in quietly, and by the time you perceive it, it has already swelled into a calamity that engulfs the world.

"The death knell sounds at destiny's cessation."

3526997.name: Eternal Lament
3526997.desc: A crystal born from the demise of black tide creatures. Advanced material used for enhancement.
3526997.lore:
Born of the void and destined to return to the void. A contorted existence wrought by decay, fated to wander the desolate earth purposelessly.

"Its life is one of ruin and sorrow."
comeFrom: Black Tide Creature at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

6103825.name: Darkveil Moonlight
6103825.desc: An alien crown left behind by the Moonlit Pegasus. Can be used for Ascension of Quantum characters.
6103825.lore:
In a legend veiled by night, Oronyx once purloined the sun's radiance to bestow it upon the moon, as the Pegasi bore the brimming moonlight to ensure the earth's luminance during the slumber of Aquila.

"How can the moon's pallid glow rival the splendor of the sun?"
comeFrom: Stagnant Shadow: "Murmuring Woods" Grove of Epiphany

ranks.name: Read the Room, Seek the Glee
ranks.descHash: Cipher's recorded DMG is <nobr>#3[i]%</nobr> of the original recorded DMG value. When using a <u>Follow-up ATK</u> caused by her Talent, increases Cipher's ATK by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> for <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> turn(s).

ranks.name: In the Fray, Nab On a Spree
ranks.descHash: When Cipher hits an enemy target, there is a <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> <u>base chance</u> of causing them to receive <nobr>#3[i]%</nobr> more DMG, lasting <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> turn(s).

ranks.name: From Thin Air, Hard to Foresee
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: The Jig Is Up, Quick to Flee
ranks.descHash: After "Patron" is attacked by an ally target, Cipher deals Quantum <u>Additional DMG</u> equal to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of Cipher's ATK to it.

ranks.name: Safe in Numbers, Light as a Bee
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: The Thief's Game, Unsung and Free
ranks.descHash: Increases DMG dealt by <u>Follow-up ATK</u>s caused by Cipher's Talent by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>. Records an additional <nobr>#3[i]%</nobr> of non-Overflow DMG dealt by this ATK. After resetting the record upon using her Ultimate, returns <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of the reset record.

skills.descHash: Deals Quantum DMG equal to #1[i]% of Cipher's ATK to one designated enemy.
skills.name: Oops, a Missed Catch

skills.descHash: There is a #6[i]% base chance to Weaken one designated enemy and adjacent targets, decreasing their DMG dealt by #3[i]% and increasing Cipher's ATK by #5[i]%, lasting for #4[i] turn(s). At the same time, deals Quantum DMG equal to #1[i]% of Cipher's ATK to one designated enemy, and Quantum DMG equal to #2[i]% of Cipher's ATK to its adjacent targets.
skills.name: Hey, Jackpot for the Taking

skills.descHash: Deals Quantum DMG equal to #1[i]% of Cipher's ATK to one designated enemy. Then, deals True DMG equal to #2[i]% of the currently recorded Talent value to one designated enemy, Quantum DMG equal to #4[i]% of Cipher's ATK to one designated enemy and its adjacent targets, and True DMG equal to #3[i]% of the current Talent's recorded value. This True DMG is Distributed to all Skill targets.
skills.name: Yours Truly, <nobr>Kitty Phantom Thief!</nobr>

skills.descHash:
When there are no enemy targets in "Patron" state on the battlefield, Cipher immediately causes one enemy target with the highest Max HP on the battlefield to become the "Patron." When using Skill and Ultimate, the primary target becomes the "Patron." The "Patron" state only takes effect on the latest target.
After the "Patron" is attacked by other ally targets, Cipher immediately launches a Follow-up ATK against the "Patron," dealing Quantum DMG equal to #1[i]% of Cipher's ATK. This effect can be triggered up to #3[i] time(s) each turn, and it resets at the start of Cipher's turn.
Cipher will record #2[i]% of the non-True DMG ally targets dealt to "Patron," but the Overflow DMG will not be recorded. The recorded value is cleared after using Ultimate.
skills.name: The Hospitable Dolosian

skills.descHash: Attacks an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduces their Toughness of the corresponding Type.
skills.name: Attack

skills.descHash:
Obtains "Zagreus's Blessing" for #1[i] second(s). During this time, Cipher will be undetectable by enemies and her movement speed increases by 50%. When approaching an enemy in the overworld/Simulated Universe/Divergent Universe, there is a chance of immediately obtaining a random Consumable. You can obtain Consumables up to #4[i] time(s) in each Earth day.
When entering battle with "Zagreus's Blessing" active, deals Quantum DMG equal to #3[i]% of Cipher's ATK to all enemies. Increases the recorded DMG Cipher obtains from this instance of DMG by #2[i]%.
skills.name: Puss in Boots

embedBonusSkill.descHash: When Cipher's SPD is greater or equal to <nobr>140</nobr>/<nobr>170</nobr>, increases CRIT Rate by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>/<nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>, and recorded value by <nobr>#3[i]%</nobr>/<nobr>#4[i]%</nobr>.
embedBonusSkill.name: Empyrean Strides

embedBonusSkill.descHash: Cipher will record <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of the non-<u>True DMG</u> ally targets dealt to the enemy targets aside from the "Patron." Overflow DMG is not recorded.
embedBonusSkill.name: <nobr>300</nobr> Rogues

embedBonusSkill.descHash: Increases the CRIT DMG dealt by the Talent's <u>Follow-up ATK</u> by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>. When Cipher is on the battlefield, DMG received by all enemy targets increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.
embedBonusSkill.name: Sleight of Sky

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: Cifera? Ah, so you've heard of me... But few call me by that name these days. Call me Cipher. It's sharper and swifter, like the wind itself. A perfect name for a master thief, don't you think?

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: So, Gray Mystery~ Where have you been to fatten your wallet, hmmm~?

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: Time is money, and I just gifted you some of mine. Consider it my gift~ Until next time!

voiceItems.title: About Self: Identity
voiceItems.text: Ever heard of Dolos? A thousand years ago, the Meow-Meow faith and the Woof-Woof faith clashed there in an epic battle. The Meow-Meow faith triumphed, and as their Holy Maiden, I inherited their sacred powers — What's that? You think it's fake? Well, it is. But wasn't it fun? I used to love telling this story when I was a kid!

voiceItems.title: About Self: The Ideal Life
voiceItems.text: Spending a day wandering where no one knows me, enjoying some goat milk honey cakes in the evening, then curling up in bed to savor the day's treasures — That's the kind of life I lead right now, and it's the best in the world.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Tools
voiceItems.text: The people of Dolos loved to invent gadgets. We had finger ring spring guns, a key that could open every lock, and you could even use that key to steal the finger ring spring gun... But the one I love the most is the "Homemade Pulleroo." It pulls anything I want my way. It's super rad~

voiceItems.title: Chat: Hood
voiceItems.text: I used to use this hood as a cloak back when it had seen better days. I didn't want to throw it away when it got all worn, and that famous Goldweaver mended it for me, see? But it's weird... it hasn't frayed or torn since, and somehow it still looks brand new.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Treasures
voiceItems.text: You get rich by making money, not saving money. Those bigwigs in the Council of Elders can hype up a piece of redsoil as a revolutionary work of art  — even the god of trickery has to bend the knee to that level of lying.

voiceItems.title: Hobbies: Theaters
voiceItems.text: When I was a kid, I always snuck into the theater to watch heroic shows about other people, and I could spend a whole day and night there. Now I can go to any theater any time I want, but I always leave before the show ends.

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: I hate rainy days. They're always so wet and sticky, and my tail gets so heavy...

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: If one day I don't come back, go to the sewers of Okhema. Follow the largest pipe all the way to the end. There's a little hideout there — Tell the kids there not to wait for me anymore and to find their own way in life.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: If everyone believes it, a lie becomes reality — easy, right? People believe what they want to anyway. Honestly, if the world turns into what everyone dreams of, is that really so bad?

voiceItems.title: About Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Heeeeey, Gray Mystery~ Did it ever occur to you that we share the same sense of humor? And honestly, when it comes to picking up random stuff off the ground, we're basically two peas in a pod~

voiceItems.title: About Aglaea
voiceItems.text: Those "actors" on the grand stage of history aren't adored just for their dazzling brilliance... What the audience truly anticipates is the moment of their fall.

voiceItems.title: About Tribbie, Trianne, and Trinnon
voiceItems.text: Those old girls love me. Whenever I tried to slip away on a secret adventure, I'd discover my backpack already crammed with all sorts of food they snuck in there — it made leaping over the wall way harder!

voiceItems.title: About Anaxa
voiceItems.text: What did they call him? "A dromas draped in finery"? And he took it just like that? Leaving aside the question of the nickname-giver's own credentials, Anaxa is undoubtedly an impressive individual...

voiceItems.title: About Phainon
voiceItems.text: The Deliverer boy looks naive, but he knows exactly what everyone wants and how much they're willing to pay... And yet everyone loves him because of the sincere way he talks. I concede my defeat.

voiceItems.title: About Mydei
voiceItems.text: When other people claim they can "defy death," I'd usually say they've knocked their head too hard. But that kid? He actually pulled it off — I've got to admit, that "Immortal Little Prince" is super awesome.

voiceItems.title: About Castorice
voiceItems.text: Isn't it just so much fun to tease her? I almost want that little Princess Homebody to lose it and scratch me, but no... she's way too nice for that. And weirdly, that just makes me angrier. I just hope she learns to take better care of herself.

voiceItems.title: About Hyacine
voiceItems.text: That pink girl could easily leave those shriveled old goons behind, you know? If she didn't care, no one else would either. But no, she's too responsible for her own good, isn't she?

voiceItems.title: Eidolon Activation
voiceItems.text: Lies and truths are nothing before the weight of sincerity.

voiceItems.title: Character Ascension
voiceItems.text: Not bad. One more for my treasure trove.

voiceItems.title: Max Level Reached
voiceItems.text: Not enough... Not enough! I can hoard even more.

voiceItems.title: Trace Activation
voiceItems.text: Good stuff ahead! Start running!

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Gray Mystery. Let's go hustle for treasures afterwards~

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Aglaea
voiceItems.text: I'm laying it out right now. I'll do everything I should, but you can stop telling me what to do, hmph!

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Castorice
voiceItems.text: So, Princess Homebody, can I have a look at your big scythe?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Tribbie
voiceItems.text: Big sis Tribbie, the wind's picking up. Shall we take flight?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Anaxa
voiceItems.text: Prof Nax~ Truth may be valuable, but all's fair in war~

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Mydei
voiceItems.text: Little prince, how will you defy death this time?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Hyacine
voiceItems.text: I'll do my best to act like an adult so you don't have to worry about me, little Hyacine.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Weakness Break
voiceItems.text: A little graze and you're calling it quits? Weak.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Danger Alert
voiceItems.text: The air here practically smells of money!

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 1
voiceItems.text: Here's the deal. Don't fight too hard, so I can go home early~

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 2
voiceItems.text: Thinking of taking advantage of me, are you?

voiceItems.title: Turn Idling
voiceItems.text: Time is money, you know? Wait any longer, and you'll owe me interest~!

voiceItems.title: Basic ATK
voiceItems.text: Lemme have a go~

voiceItems.title: Skill 1
voiceItems.text: Treasure~ Come to me!

voiceItems.title: Skill 2
voiceItems.text: This cat~ Will take it all!

voiceItems.title: Hit by Light Attack
voiceItems.text: Amateur...

voiceItems.title: Hit by Heavy Attack
voiceItems.text: Something's fishy!

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate
voiceItems.text: Our cute play session is over.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Unleash
voiceItems.text: A lie that everyone believes in becomes a reality. Gotcha~

voiceItems.title: Downed
voiceItems.text: This... is the Flame-Chase...

voiceItems.title: Return to Battle
voiceItems.text: Guess how many lives I have? Mmm?

voiceItems.title: Health Recovery
voiceItems.text: Thanks. That feels way better.

voiceItems.title: Technique
voiceItems.text: Cat-and-mouse time!

voiceItems.title: Battle Won
voiceItems.text: What a big haul. I'll be back~!

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 1
voiceItems.text: Free stuff is always the best~

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 2
voiceItems.text: The kittens are gonna eat well tonight~

voiceItems.title: Precious Treasure Opening
voiceItems.text: I am the Titan of Fortune!

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 1
voiceItems.text: I can solve these party tricks in under a minute... Don't underestimate the people of Dolos!

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 2
voiceItems.text: Come ON! Can you please make it harder next time?

voiceItems.title: Enemy Target Found
voiceItems.text: My hair's standing up... Maaaybe we should go the other way?

voiceItems.title: Returning to Town
voiceItems.text: Oh! There's something fun over there! Come on! Let's go~!

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
In the fallen city of bandits, Dolos, the 300 Rogues run wild and free, the entire city at their mercy.
Race onward, fleet-Footed Thief Star Cifera, Chrysos Heir of the "Trickery" Coreflame, and may your web of lies spread with the breeze throughout all lands.
—"Tryna trick me? Fetch better scripts!"

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
"At the end of the Month of Weaving, the temple lost bread, a bag of dried fruits, and numerous candles.
Though trifles, sacrilege and disorder merit severe punishment.
Suspect: gray-haired, cat-eared, slight build. Agile and cunning. Exercise caution.
5,000 for clues. 10,000 for capture alive."

—Wanted poster in Dolos

"Catch her, catch her!"
The prison-filled square, reeking of filth and echoing with the sounds of whipping and wailing.
A ragged girl darts through crowds, golden blood trailing.

She ran past the platform, where a corpulent priest was delivering a sermon to the city's gathered faithful.
"In Kephale's name, let us praise and give thanks for this beautiful world..."

"Justice, sincerity, and forgiveness..."
"— Let us water our souls with virtues, and conquer calamities with love..."
Just as the girl glanced back — snarling hounds lunge, leaving another three fresh wounds on her face.

"Treasure means naught to Titans, yet proves your piety..."
Amid cheers, silks, feasts, and jewels rain onto the altar.

"Shun the Chrysos Heirs' lies. Have faith in Kephale, pray sincerely, and god shall deliver salvation..."
She pushed through the crowd, the bread in her hand lost somewhere along the way.
She looked around in desperation, only to see faces gazing down at her, surging toward her like a restless tide.

Her legs falter. Mocking glances and threatening smiles blur before her eyes.
But the voices from afar had already bitten into her ears, and so she couldn't stop.
"Thief!"
"Criminal!"
"Wretch!"

She closes her eyes and plunges from that hundred-yard wall.
"So... hungry..."
Icy waters drown her consciousness.
With her life as a wager, another Pyrrhic victory in this lethal chase.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
Wandering to the holy city of dawn, she found the legends of the Chrysos Heirs echoing in the town — yet when she saw its squalid alleys and corners, she felt this place was not that much different from Dolos.

"Hmph! Flame-Chase? Heroes? Cifera, with her experience, smells unspeakable schemes afoot!"
Deeming the Chrysos Heirs glory-hungry frauds, she targets a golden weaving workshop.
"Honey brew? Chessboard... and a weird lute? These have got to be looted goods..."
She guzzles the honey brew, devours grape-leaf rice, and toys with crystal chess pieces.
"Heh, even the floor spins..."

When she woke from her drunk stupor, she found a perfumed letter in her hand.
Goosebumps erupting, she tossed off the blanket, retreating to her shadowed den.

"Little Glutton:
Are you having fun? You turned the weaving hall into a playground for your reckless antics.
You tasted the honey brew, but couldn't handle it. The chessboard is in disarray, and even the old lute wasn't spared.

There's something you must remember: The honey brew must be finished, and there's always room for change in the world.
I know your skills are quite impressive, so go fix the lute you damaged. Fortunately, that knight commander wasn't here, or she would've surely pinned your tail with her sword."

Holding the confidential letter, the girl felt a vague, indescribable emotion rising within her for the first time.
"People from the big city... they sure have a lot of tricks up their sleeves."

The stray cat waited day after day, yet no harsh scolding ever came.
So, she whistled, tossed a coin in the air, and time and time again "accidentally" stopped in front of the weaving shop.
"Ciphy, if you want something to eat, just tell us directly!" The red-haired girls always had a heap of food prepared.
While following the weaver at work, she often heard stories of those heroes.

"For those with golden blood, Flame-Chase is a journey of endless loss... even life itself holds little worth."
The weavers spoke of the violin's final wail, the chess pieces that fell in a doomed game, the shattered pathways splitting into a thousand fragments...
"...And what does that have to do with me? I just want a proper meal."
She muttered, curling her fingers. A tiny golden blood drop welled up from her pricked fingertip.

That night, she silently slipped out of the weaving shop once again.
"It's okay. Run, Cifera.
Only you know where your destination shall end up..."
Under the moonlight, her figure vanished from sight, leaving behind only the weaver's murmurs in the room.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
"Zagreus, the old god of trickery:

Stealing treasures, provoking the gods, stirring up conflict...
We've grown tired of your old tricks.
On the upcoming Spirit Day, the 300 Rogues will stage their most spectacular performance yet in Amphoreus.

The world will be ours to claim, cowardly god!
Watch as we turn it upside down!"
A proclamation adorned with cat paw prints, scattered across the city-states of Amphoreus.

"From Okhema, head north, cross the snow-covered mountains, and you'll reach Aenionus.
There, I secretly changed two characters on the Granite Code, winning a rogue's contract in a trial that decided life and death.
In the southern bay, I snuck aboard an anchored ship and dueled a rogue in the middle of a storm. Ugh, I hate water the most of all!
Then guess what? In a stroke of genius, I whipped out my Pulleroo and took his sword away!
And there's more — under the blazing desert sun, I competed with outlaws to see who could last the longest without water, and in the dense jungle, I raced against hunters... until all 300 Rogues found their place once more..."

The girl in golden boots spoke animatedly about her journey.
"And then, it's time for every usurper, parasite, and slaver in all of Amphoreus to witness the power of the so-called scoundrels they despise!"

She recalled how the moment the Coin of Whimsy fell, three hundred Thief Stars streaked across the sky, descending upon the lands of Amphoreus.
The lofty tyrants tumbled from their thrones, whip-wielding slavers fled in disgrace, torrents of gold vanished into thin air, only to rain down from the heavens upon the starving and the cold...

During that grand spectacle, Zagreus could not resist the temptation and revealed themselves, falling right into the Chrysos Heirs' ambush.
The blazing Coreflame, at last, fell silent within the vortex's core.
In the city of Okhema, whispers began to spread of a demigod swift as a shadow, a guardian of the vagrants, a scourge to the wicked —

"What I am capable of is just to run."

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
"To all chaplains, high priests, and acolytes of the city-states, to the faithful under the radiance of the Throne of Worlds, and to all sentient beings:

Since the passing of the high chaplain, the Gem of All Worlds has gone missing.
Upon investigation, no signs of forced entry or damage were found at the scene. After its theft, multiple reports claim to have seen the gem enter the black market, where it was exchanged for a vast sum of Balance Coins.
Anyone providing valuable information will receive 5,000 Balance Coins. The one who captures the culprit will be rewarded with 100,000 Balance Coins."

— A faded proclamation from the Council of Elders
"Been a while since I came back, and they still haven't taken this down?"

She remembered the day the notice was posted, the moment she had no choice but to say goodbye.
She couldn't meet the weaver's eyes and could only turn away, fleeing Okhema in haste.

Centuries later, new heroes emerged from across Amphoreus. Wearing her hood, she looked at the old marketplace from afar, but few familiar faces remained.
"Pickled candy has a new flavor?"
She crumpled the wrapper and casually flicked it toward the flowerbed.
"Glass marbles? Haven't played with these in ages!"
She weighed one in her hand, aiming as she tossed it into the water.
...
Moments later, from the flowerbed, the water, the trees — figures dressed as assassins tumbled down one after another.
And in the distance ahead, bathed in light, stood the young hero, returning in triumph.

She watched from the shadows until the golden thread beside her trembled.
"Seamstress, after all this time, your golden thread is still as sharp as ever. If I don't want to get caught by you, I'd better get going!"

She stretched lazily, crouching slightly as the wind swept past, carrying the scent of the wild.

A golden streak of lightning once again shot from Okhema toward the eternal night.
In the howling wind, she felt as if she had returned to her childhood, to those countless races where life itself was the wager.
"Run, Cifera...
Only you know where your destination shall end up...
And one day, you'll run toward that brilliant future..."

In the instant the lightning split the night, it was as if she had already illuminated the entire world.

name: Cipher
descHash: In the fallen city of bandits, Dolos, the <nobr>300</nobr> Rogues run wild and free, the entire city at their mercy. Race onward, fleet-Footed Thief Star Cifera, Chrysos Heir of the "Trickery" Coreflame, and may your web of lies spread with the breeze throughout all lands— "Tryna trick me? Fetch better scripts!"
